content: There are currently about 65 species of **mammals in Singapore**. Since the [founding years of modern Singapore](/wiki/Founding_years_of_modern_Singapore) in 1819, over 90 species have been recorded, including [megafauna](/wiki/Megafauna) such as tigers, leopards and [sambar deer](/wiki/Sambar_deer). Most of these have since become [locally extinct](/wiki/Locally_extinct) largely due to rapid urban development, with occasional large [mammals](/wiki/Mammal) such as Asian elephants swimming across the [Straits of Johor](/wiki/Straits_of_Johor) from [Johor](/wiki/Johor), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia). Many surviving species have critically low population numbers, the most seriously endangered being the [cream-coloured giant squirrel](/wiki/Cream-coloured_giant_squirrel), last sighted in 1995 and now possibly extirpated. The [Raffles' banded langur](/wiki/Raffles%27_banded_langur) is also down to around 60 individuals. However, some species have been rediscovered in more remote parts of the country, such as the [Malayan porcupine](/wiki/Malayan_porcupine) which was detected on [Pulau Tekong](/wiki/Pulau_Tekong) in 2005, and the [greater mouse-deer](/wiki/Greater_mouse-deer) on [Pulau Ubin](/wiki/Pulau_Ubin) in 2009. The most commonly seen native mammals are the [crab-eating macaque](/wiki/Crab-eating_macaque) and [plantain squirrel](/wiki/Plantain_squirrel). The largest terrestrial mammal is the sambar deer, however, its population still remains extremely small. The [wild boar](/wiki/Wild_boar) is far more common, found in relatively large numbers throughout the main island, and also on the offshore islands of Pulau Ubin and Pulau Tekong. The largest marine mammals are species like the [dugong](/wiki/Dugong) and [dolphins](/wiki/Dolphin). ## Order [Artiodactyla](/wiki/Artiodactyla) (even-toed ungulates) Family [Suidae](/wiki/Suidae) (pigs) - [Wild boar](/wiki/Wild_boar) (*Sus scrofa*) **LC** – [Tuas](/wiki/Tuas), [Jurong](/wiki/Jurong), [Western Catchment](/wiki/Western_Water_Catchment), [Lim Chu Kang](/wiki/Lim_Chu_Kang), [Kranji](/wiki/Kranji), [Choa Chu Kang](/wiki/Choa_Chu_Kang), [Bukit Panjang](/wiki/Bukit_Panjang), [Bukit Batok](/wiki/Bukit_Batok), [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah), [Central Catchment](/wiki/Central_Water_Catchment), [Seletar](/wiki/Seletar), [Sengkang](/wiki/Sengkang), [Punggol](/wiki/Punggol), [Coney Island](/wiki/Coney_Island,_Singapore), [Lorong Halus](/wiki/Lorong_Halus), [Pasir Ris](/wiki/Pasir_Ris), [Changi](/wiki/Changi), [Pulau Ubin](/wiki/Pulau_Ubin), [Pulau Tekong](/wiki/Pulau_Tekong) Family [Cervidae](/wiki/Cervidae) (deer) - [Sambar deer](/wiki/Sambar_deer) (*Rusa unicolor*) **VU** – [Bukit Brown](/wiki/Bukit_Brown_Cemetery), Bukit Timah, Central Catchment - [Southern red muntjac](/wiki/Southern_red_muntjac) (*Muntiacus muntjak*) **LC** – Central Catchment (possibly extirpated, recent sightings may be escapees from captivity), Pulau Tekong, unverified sighting Family [Tragulidae](/wiki/Tragulidae) (mousedeer) - [Lesser mouse-deer](/wiki/Lesser_mouse-deer) (*Tragulus kanchil*) **LC** – Central Catchment - [Greater mouse-deer](/wiki/Greater_mouse-deer) (*Tragulus napu*) **LC** – Pulau Ubin, Western Catchment ## Order [Carnivora](/wiki/Carnivora) (carnivores) Family [Herpestidae](/wiki/Herpestidae) (mongooses) - [Short-tailed mongoose](/wiki/Short-tailed_mongoose) (*Urva brachyura*) **NT** historical record is based on a specimen that is likely to have been an escapee Family [Viverridae](/wiki/Viverridae) (civets) - [Small-toothed palm civet](/wiki/Small-toothed_palm_civet) (*Arctogalidia trivirgata*) **LC** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment - [Otter civet](/wiki/Otter_civet) (*Cynogale bennettii*) **EN** doubtful, based on old specimen without precise collection data - [Masked palm civet](/wiki/Masked_palm_civet) (*Paguma larvata*) **LC** indeterminate – Central Catchment Pulau Tekong, possible escapee (unverified sightings), Adam Road (roadkill in 2021) - [Asian palm civet](/wiki/Asian_palm_civet) (*Paradoxurus hermaphroditus*) **LC** – widespread across mainland Singapore in forests, woodlands, parks, and urban areas with trees, Pulau Ubin - [Large-spotted civet](/wiki/Large-spotted_civet) (*Viverra megaspila*) **EN** presence doubtful, historical record is likely based on misidentified Malay civet - [Malayan civet](/wiki/Malayan_civet) (*Viverra tangalunga*) **LC** – Central Catchment, possibly Pulau Tekong but has been confused with large Indian civet - [Large Indian civet](/wiki/Large_Indian_civet) (*Viverra zibetha*) **LC** indeterminate, [Jalan Bahar](/wiki/Jalan_Bahar), possibly Pulau Tekong but has been confused with Malay civet, unverified sightings from Central Catchment - [Small Indian civet](/wiki/Small_Indian_civet) (*Viverricula indica*) **LC** doubtful Family [Mustelidae](/wiki/Mustelidae) (weasels, otters and relatives) - [Asian small-clawed otter](/wiki/Asian_small-clawed_otter) (*Aonyx cinereus*) **VU** – Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong, sightings of lone individuals in mainland Singapore might be escapees from captivity - [Smooth-coated otter](/wiki/Smooth-coated_otter) (*Lutrogale perspicillata*) **VU** – mangroves and coasts, rivers, canals, reservoirs, and lakes in many locations on mainland Singapore, also often seen travelling overland or hunting in ornamental fish ponds, Pulau Ubin, [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa), [St. John's Island](/wiki/Saint_John%27s_Island), Pulau Semakau Family [Felidae](/wiki/Felidae) (cats) - [Sunda clouded leopard](/wiki/Sunda_clouded_leopard) (*Neofelis diardi*) **VU** doubtful, based on single specimen claimed to have been killed in Changi in 1898 - [Leopard cat](/wiki/Leopard_cat) (*Prionailurus bengalensis*) **LC** – Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong, Western Catchment, Central Catchment, Sungei Buloh - [Flat-headed cat](/wiki/Flat-headed_cat) (*Prionailurus planiceps*) **EN** presence doubtful, based on single specimen from former [Raffles Museum](/wiki/Raffles_Museum) collection that has since been lost ## Order [Cetacea](/wiki/Cetacea) (cetaceans) Family [Delphinidae](/wiki/Delphinidae) (marine dolphins) - Common dolphin (*[Delphinus delphis](/wiki/Delphinus_delphis)*) **LC** - Irrawaddy dolphin (*[Orcaella brevirostris](/wiki/Orcaella_brevirostris)*) – [Singapore Strait](/wiki/Singapore_Strait) **EN** - False killer whale (*[Pseudorca crassidens](/wiki/Pseudorca_crassidens)*) (vagrant) – Tuas **NT** - Indo-Pacific humpback dolphin (*[Sousa chinensis](/wiki/Sousa_chinensis)*) – [Straits of Johor](/wiki/Straits_of_Johor), Singapore Strait **VU** - Indo-Pacific bottlenose dolphin (*[Tursiops aduncus](/wiki/Tursiops_aduncus)*) – Singapore Strait **NT** Family [Phocoenidae](/wiki/Phocoenidae) (porpoises) - Finless porpoise (*[Neophocaena phocaenoides](/wiki/Neophocaena_phocaenoides)*) – Singapore Strait **VU** Family [Physeteridae](/wiki/Physeteridae) (sperm whale) - Sperm whale (*[Physeter macrocephalus](/wiki/Physeter_macrocephalus)*) (lone carcass in 2015) – Singapore Strait **VU** ## Order [Chiroptera](/wiki/Chiroptera) (bats) Family [Pteropodidae](/wiki/Pteropodidae) (Old World fruit bats) - Lesser dog-faced fruit bat ([*Cynopterus brachyotis*](/wiki/Lesser_short-nosed_fruit_bat)) - common and widespread **LC** - Cave nectar bat (*[Eonycteris spelaea](/wiki/Eonycteris_spelaea)*) - common and widespread **LC** - Common long-tongued fruit bat (*[Macroglossus minimus](/wiki/Macroglossus_minimus)*) - Sungei Buloh, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong **LC** - Dusky fruit bat (*[Penthetor lucasi](/wiki/Penthetor_lucasi)*) – Bukit Timah **LC** - Malayan flying fox (*[Pteropus vampyrus](/wiki/Pteropus_vampyrus)*) (visitor, former resident) - Central Catchment, Hampstead Wetlands, Pulau Ubin **NT** - Geoffroy's rousette (*[Rousettus amplexicaudatus](/wiki/Rousettus_amplexicaudatus)*) (indeterminate, possibly extirpated) **LC** Family [Emballonuridae](/wiki/Emballonuridae) (sheath-tailed bats) - Lesser sheath-tailed bat (*[Emballonura monticola](/wiki/Emballonura_monticola)*) – Bukit Timah, Pulau Ubin **LC** - Pouched tomb bat (*[Saccolaimus saccolaimus](/wiki/Saccolaimus_saccolaimus)*) **LC** - Long-winged tomb bat (*[Taphozous longimanus](/wiki/Taphozous_longimanus)*) – Pulau Ubin **LC** - Black-bearded tomb bat (*[Taphozous melanopogon](/wiki/Taphozous_melanopogon)*) **LC** Family [Nycteridae](/wiki/Nycteridae) (hollow-faced bats) - Southeast Asian hollow-faced bat (*[Nycteris tragata](/wiki/Nycteris_tragata)*) – Central Catchment **NT** Family [Megadermatidae](/wiki/Megadermatidae) (false vampires) - Lesser false vampire (*[Megaderma spasma](/wiki/Megaderma_spasma)*) – Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong **LC** Family [Rhinolophidae](/wiki/Rhinolophidae) (horseshoe bats) - Glossy horseshoe bat (*[Rhinolophus refulgens](/wiki/Rhinolophus_refulgens)*) – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment **LC** - Woolly horseshoe bat (*[Rhinolophus morio](/wiki/Rhinolophus_morio)*) - Central Catchment, Changi **LC** - Lesser woolly horseshoe bat (*[Rhinolophus sedulus](/wiki/Rhinolophus_sedulus)*) (indeterminate, possibly extirpated) **NT** - Lesser brown horseshoe bat (*[Rhinolophus stheno](/wiki/Rhinolophus_stheno)*) (indeterminate, possibly extirpated) **LC** - Trefoil horseshoe bat (*[Rhinolophus trifoliatus](/wiki/Rhinolophus_trifoliatus)*) – Central Catchment, Pulau Tekong **NT** Family [Hipposideridae](/wiki/Hipposideridae) (Old World leaf-nosed bats) - Bicolored roundleaf bat (*[Hipposideros bicolor](/wiki/Hipposideros_bicolor)*) – Bukit Timah **LC** - Fawn roundleaf bat (*[Hipposideros cervinus](/wiki/Hipposideros_cervinus)*) (indeterminate, possibly extirpated) **LC** - Ashy roundleaf bat (*[Hipposideros cineraceus](/wiki/Hipposideros_cineraceus)*) – Pulau Ubin **LC** - Ridley's roundleaf bat (*[Hipposideros ridleyi](/wiki/Hipposideros_ridleyi)*) (indeterminate, possibly extirpated) **VU** Family [Vespertilionidae](/wiki/Vespertilionidae) (evening bats) - Big-eared pipistrelle (*[Hypsugo macrotis](/wiki/Hypsugo_macrotis)*) – Pulau Ubin **DD** - Hardwicke's woolly bat (*[Kerivoula hardwickii](/wiki/Kerivoula_hardwickii)*) – Central Catchment, Pulau Tekong **LC** - Brown tube-nosed bat (*[Murina suilla](/wiki/Murina_suilla)*) – Pulau Tekong **LC** - Horsfield's large-footed myotis (*[Myotis horsfieldii](/wiki/Myotis_horsfieldii)*) – widespread **LC** - Whiskered myotis (*[Myotis muricola](/wiki/Myotis_muricola)*) - widespread **LC** - Singapore whiskered bat (*[Myotis oreias](/wiki/Myotis_oreias)*) – endemic to Singapore, possibly globally extinct, but might not be a valid taxon **DD** - Javan pipistrelle (*[Pipistrellus javanicus](/wiki/Pipistrellus_javanicus)*) – widespread, recent records from [Ayer Rajah](/wiki/Ayer_Rajah), [Paya Lebar](/wiki/Paya_Lebar), [Punggol](/wiki/Punggol), [Upper Thomson](/wiki/Upper_Thomson), [Kent Ridge](/wiki/Kent_Ridge), Sentosa **LC** - Narrow-winged pipistrelle (*[Pipistrellus stenopterus](/wiki/Pipistrellus_stenopterus)*) – [Singapore Botanic Gardens](/wiki/Singapore_Botanic_Gardens), [Holland Village](/wiki/Holland_Village,_Singapore), Rochester Park, most recent record from Bukit Timah **LC** - Asiatic lesser yellow bat (*[Scotophilus kuhlii](/wiki/Scotophilus_kuhlii)*) - common and widespread **LC** - Lesser bamboo bat (*Tylonycteris fulvida*) – Bukit Timah **LC** - Greater bamboo bat (*Tylonycteris malayana*) - widespread **LC** Family [Molossidae](/wiki/Molossidae) (free-tailed bats) - Naked bulldog bat (*[Cheiromeles torquatus](/wiki/Cheiromeles_torquatus)*) – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment, [Sembawang](/wiki/Sembawang), Sentosa **LC** - Wrinkle-lipped free-tailed bat (*[Chaerephon plicatus](/wiki/Chaerephon_plicatus)*) (indeterminate, possibly extirpated) **LC** ## Order [Dermoptera](/wiki/Dermoptera) (colugo) Family [Cynocephalidae](/wiki/Cynocephalidae) (colugo) - Malayan colugo or Malayan flying lemur (*[Galeopterus variegatus](/wiki/Sunda_flying_lemur)*) – Bukit Timah, Bukit Batok, Central Catchment, Bukit Brown, Gallop Road, Portsdown, Changi **LC** ## Order [Eulipotyphla](/wiki/Eulipotyphla) ([insectivores](/wiki/Insectivora)) Family [Soricidae](/wiki/Soricidae) (shrews) - Malayan shrew (*[Crocidura malayana](/wiki/Crocidura_malayana)*) – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment **LC** - House shrew (*[Suncus murinus](/wiki/Suncus_murinus)*) – urban **LC** Family [Erinaceidae](/wiki/Erinaceidae) (hedgehogs and gymnures) - Moonrat (*[Echinosorex gymnura](/wiki/Moonrat)*) (doubtful - based on single specimen from former Raffles Museum collection that has since been lost) **LC** ## Order [Perissodactyla](/wiki/Perissodactyla) (odd-toed ungulates) Family [Tapiridae](/wiki/Tapiridae) (tapirs) - Malayan tapir (*[Tapirus indicus](/wiki/Tapirus_indicus)*) (vagrant) – Pulau Ubin, Changi, Punggol **EN** ## Order [Pholidota](/wiki/Pholidota) (pangolins) Family [Manidae](/wiki/Manidae) (pangolins) - Sunda pangolin (*[Manis javanica](/wiki/Manis_javanica)*) – **CR**; occurs in Bukit Timah, Bukit Batok, Bukit Panjang, Central Catchment, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong, Western Catchment, Labrador, may wander into built-up areas ## Order [Primates](/wiki/Primates) (primates) Family [Lorisidae](/wiki/Lorisidae) (lorises) - [Sunda slow loris](/wiki/Sunda_slow_loris) (*Nycticebus coucang*) **EN** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment, Pulau Tekong Family [Cercopithecidae](/wiki/Cercopithecidae) (Old World monkeys) - [Crab-eating macaque](/wiki/Crab-eating_macaque) (*Macaca fascicularis*) **VU** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment, Sungei Buloh, Western Catchment, Bukit Batok, Woodlands Waterfront, Admiralty Park, Punggol, Coney Island, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong, Sentosa, Sisters Islands; lone individuals and small groups occasionally seen in parks and urban areas elsewhere in Singapore - [Southern pig-tailed macaque](/wiki/Southern_pig-tailed_macaque) (*Macaca nemestrina*) **EN** (doubtful, historical records in Singapore are likely to be based on escapees from captivity), Tengeh Reservoir, individual seen in 2020 - [Raffles' banded langur](/wiki/Raffles%27_banded_langur) (*Presbytis femoralis*) **CR** – (endemic) around 70 left in Central Catchment, Upper Thomson - [Dusky leaf monkey](/wiki/Dusky_leaf_monkey) (*Trachypithecus obscurus*) **EN** – Kent Ridge, likely escapee in 2008; Central Catchment, colonisation in 2019 with the appearance of a trio which likely originated from Johor. ## Order [Proboscidea](/wiki/Proboscidea) (elephants) Family [Elephantidae](/wiki/Elephantidae) (elephants) - [Asian elephant](/wiki/Asian_elephant) (*Elephas maximus*) **EN** (vagrant) Pulau Tekong (1990), Pulau Ubin (1991) ## Order [Rodentia](/wiki/Rodent) (rodents) Family [Muridae](/wiki/Muridae) (mice and rats) - [House mouse](/wiki/House_mouse) (*Mus musculus*) **LC** – urban - [Rajah spiny rat](/wiki/Rajah_spiny_rat) (*Maxomys rajah*) **VU** – Central Catchment - [Polynesian rat](/wiki/Polynesian_rat) (*Rattus exulans]*) **LC** – urban, forest edge - [Brown rat](/wiki/Brown_rat) (*Rattus norvegicus*) **LC** (introduced) – urban - [Tanezumi rat](/wiki/Tanezumi_rat) (*Rattus tanezumi*) **LC** – urban, forest edge - [Malayan field rat](/wiki/Malayan_field_rat) (*Rattus tiomanicus*) **LC** - Annandale's rat (*[Sundamys annandalei](/wiki/Annandale%27s_Rat)*) **LC** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment, Pulau Ubin Family [Spalacidae](/wiki/Spalacidae) (mole-rats) - [Large bamboo rat](/wiki/Large_bamboo_rat) (*Rhizomys sumatrensis*) **LC** doubtful, historical records are likely escapees Family [Sciuridae](/wiki/Sciuridae) (squirrels) - [Finlayson's squirrel](/wiki/Finlayson%27s_squirrel) (*Callosciurus finlaysonii*) **LC** (introduced) – Bidadari, Woodleigh - [Plantain squirrel](/wiki/Plantain_squirrel) (*Callosciurus notatus*) **LC** – widespread and common on [mainland](/wiki/Pulau_Ujong), Sentosa, Pulau Tekong, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Semakau - [Prevost's squirrel](/wiki/Prevost%27s_squirrel) (*Callosciurus prevostii*) **LC** (presence uncertain) - [Red-cheeked flying squirrel](/wiki/Red-cheeked_flying_squirrel) (*Hylopetes spadiceus*) **LC** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment - [Javanese flying squirrel](/wiki/Javanese_flying_squirrel) (*Iomys horsfieldii*) **LC** – Bukit Batok, Bukit Timah, Central Catchment - [Red giant flying squirrel](/wiki/Red_giant_flying_squirrel) (*Petaurista petaurista*) **LC** possibly extirpated - [Shrew-faced squirrel](/wiki/Shrew-faced_squirrel) (*Rhinosciurus laticaudatus*) **NT** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment - [Slender squirrel](/wiki/Slender_squirrel) (*Sundasciurus tenuis*) **LC** – Bukit Timah, Bukit Batok, Central Catchment, Singapore Botanic Gardens Family [Hystricidae](/wiki/Hystricidae) (Old World porcupines) - [Malayan porcupine](/wiki/Malayan_porcupine) (*Hystrix brachyura*) **LC** – Pulau Tekong, Pulau Ubin, Bukit Timah, Central Catchment, Western Catchment ## Order [Scandentia](/wiki/Scandentia) (treeshrews) Family [Tupaiidae](/wiki/Tupaiidae) (treeshrews) - [Common treeshrew](/wiki/Common_treeshrew) (*Tupaia glis*) **LC** – Bukit Timah, Central Catchment, Singapore Botanic Gardens, Portsdown, Bidadari, Bedok, Bukit Batok, Jurong Hill, Kent Ridge, Sungei Buloh, Western Catchment, Pulau Ubin ## Order [Sirenia](/wiki/Sirenia) (sea cows) Family [Dugongidae](/wiki/Dugongidae) (dugong) - [Dugong](/wiki/Dugong) (*Dugong dugon*) **VU** – Straits of Johor, Singapore Strait ## Extirpated species - [Binturong](/wiki/Binturong) (*Arctictis binturong*) **VU** - [Dhole](/wiki/Dhole) (*Cuon alpinus*) **EN** - [Sun bear](/wiki/Sun_bear) (*Helarctos malayanus*) **VU** unverified sightings on Pulau Tekong in 1980s - [Three-striped ground squirrel](/wiki/Three-striped_ground_squirrel) (*Lariscus insignis*) **LC** - [Hairy-nosed otter](/wiki/Hairy-nosed_otter) (*Lutra sumatrana*) **EN** - [Red spiny rat](/wiki/Red_spiny_rat) (*Maxomys surifer*) **LC** formerly recorded in Bukit Timah - [Leopard](/wiki/Leopard) (*Panthera pardus*) unverified sightings on Pulau Tekong in 1980s **VU** - [Tiger](/wiki/Tiger) (*Panthera tigris*) **EN** - [Cream-coloured giant squirrel](/wiki/Cream-coloured_giant_squirrel) (*Ratufa affinis*) **NT** formerly recorded in Bukit Timah, Central Catchment - [Bornean bearded pig](/wiki/Bornean_bearded_pig) (*Sus barbatus*) – no historical records but likely formerly present due to records from Johor and Riau Islands, and ability to reach islands by swimming - [List of birds of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_birds_of_Singapore) - [List of reptiles of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_reptiles_of_Singapore) - [List of amphibians of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_amphibians_of_Singapore)
title: List of mammals of Singapore
